column4: H25: it is kwalletmanager; try with: sudo apt-get remove kwalletmanager

that's not the program because apt-get says it doesnt exist

still not installed
It may be integrated with KDE-base-runtime; all I can think of is disabling it, that way it won't bother you anymore; try "/usr/bin/kwalletmanager --show
bash: /usr/bin/kwalletmanager: No such file or directory
uhmm I suppose it changed with KDE 4, well open it the way you know and browse preferences; it has a disable kwallet option.
That's all I can think of right now, =(
Bushman: I cant open kdewallet its just constantly prompting me for a password every time i do anything in a program I'm using
I'm reading KDE4 forums, seems like the best way to stop the annoyance is to set a blank password, and hit on "allow always" when it jumps.
You don't have it under KMenu > System Settings > Advanced > KDE Wallet?

can you summon it with Alt+F2?

there's no trace of this thing on my system
